segment.source: How to Apply Network Settings to a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Apply Network Settings to a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: How to Apply Network Settings to a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Apply Network Settings to a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: How to Apply Network Settings to a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Apply Network Settings to a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: Administrators can define the network settings for each MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Administrators can define the network settings for each MED-V workspace.

segment.source: All network settings are configured in the Policy module, on the Network tab.
segment.target: All network settings are configured in the Policy module, on the Network tab.

segment.source: To apply network settings to a MED-V workspace
segment.target: To apply network settings to a MED-V workspace

segment.source: Click the MED-V workspace to configure.
segment.target: Click the MED-V workspace to configure.

segment.source: In the Network pane, configure the settings as described in the following table.
segment.target: In the Network pane, configure the settings as described in the following table.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, select Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, select Commit.

segment.source: MED-V Workspace Network Properties
segment.target: MED-V Workspace Network Properties

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: TCP/IP Properties
segment.target: TCP/IP Properties

segment.source: Use host's IP address (NAT)—The workspace will use NAT to share the host's IP for outgoing traffic.
segment.target: Use host's IP address (NAT)—The workspace will use NAT to share the host's IP for outgoing traffic.

segment.source: Use different IP address than host (Bridge)—The MED-V workspace will have its own network address, usually obtained via DHCP.
segment.target: Use different IP address than host (Bridge)—The MED-V workspace will have its own network address, usually obtained via DHCP.

segment.source: Select the Map multiple adapters into Workspace check box when the host computer has multiple adapters.
segment.target: Select the Map multiple adapters into Workspace check box when the host computer has multiple adapters.

segment.source: It is recommended to use this configuration when the host moves between different networks using different adapters.
segment.target: It is recommended to use this configuration when the host moves between different networks using different adapters.

segment.source: DNS Server
segment.target: DNS Server

segment.source: Don't change—DNS settings that are set within the MED-V workspace virtual machine will not be changed.
segment.target: Don't change—DNS settings that are set within the MED-V workspace virtual machine will not be changed.

segment.source: Use Host's DNS address—MED-V workspace DNS settings will be synchronized to match the host's settings.
segment.target: Use Host's DNS address—MED-V workspace DNS settings will be synchronized to match the host's settings.

segment.source: The DNS synchronization is dynamic.
segment.target: The DNS synchronization is dynamic.

segment.source: It is synchronized periodically with the host so that if it is changed on the host, it will change dynamically in the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: It is synchronized periodically with the host so that if it is changed on the host, it will change dynamically in the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Use specific DNS addresses—The MED-V workspace will use a specific DNS, as specified.
segment.target: Use specific DNS addresses—The MED-V workspace will use a specific DNS, as specified.

segment.source: In the Primary and Secondary fields, enter the primary and secondary DNS addresses.
segment.target: In the Primary and Secondary fields, enter the primary and secondary DNS addresses.

segment.source: Select the Append Host's DNS addresses check box to append the host to the configured DNS addresses.
segment.target: Select the Append Host's DNS addresses check box to append the host to the configured DNS addresses.

segment.source: Assign DNS Suffixes
segment.target: Assign DNS Suffixes

segment.source: Assign the following suffixes—Select this check box to assign specific DNS suffixes; in the box, enter a suffix or multiple suffixes separated by commas.
segment.target: Assign the following suffixes—Select this check box to assign specific DNS suffixes; in the box, enter a suffix or multiple suffixes separated by commas.

segment.source: Append host suffixes—Select this check box to append the host suffixes to the DNS address.
segment.target: Append host suffixes—Select this check box to append the host suffixes to the DNS address.
